Package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics

Class CartesianProduct

java.lang.Object
org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.CartesianProduct
public final class CartesianProduct extends Object
Fluent API for generating tuples from a mixed-radix Cartesian product.

Given non-negative dimensions d[0], d[1], ..., d[m-1], this iterable yields every m-length tuple t such that 0 <= t[i] < d[i] for each coordinate.

Usage


 // 3 attributes, each with 3 values (e.g., a SET card): 3^3 = 27 tuples
 for (int[] t : CartesianProduct.of(3, 3, 3)) {
   System.out.println(Arrays.toString(t));
 }

 // Combine with IndexingAdapter to map indices to real objects per coordinate:
 // Suppose suits = ["♠","♥"], ranks = ["A","K","Q"], colors = ["Black","Red"]
 // Then dims = [suits.size(), ranks.size(), colors.size()] = [2,3,2]

Order of generation

Lexicographic with the rightmost coordinate varying fastest (odometer behavior). Start at [0,0,...,0], then repeatedly increment the last position; on overflow, carry left and reset trailing positions to 0.

Counting

Total tuples = Π dims[i].

Edge cases

  • No dimensions (i.e., of()): one empty tuple [].
  • If any dimension is zero and there is at least one dimension, the product is empty.
  • Negative dimensions are rejected with IllegalArgumentException.

Implementation note: Each Iterator.next() returns a defensive copy to protect the iterator's state.

Since:
0.2.0
